resources.string: This device was not paired. You can do so from one of your previous devices.\nIf you do not have access to your previous key (From older devices) you can generate a new one.
You can set a password to protect this device, this will encrypt the local database with a key derived from it. You will have to enter this password everytime the app starts.
Leave the new password field empty to remove your password
A device password is used to encrypt the local database but it is needed everytime the database is opened. This password is not recoverable.
You need to pair this device before you can confirm its identity
If you do not have access to your previous key (From older devices) you can generate a new one.
You just generated a new key, would you like to pair all the other devices? (This process might take a few seconds depending on the number of devices)
Do you want to erase all data related to this user?
Are you sure you want to pair this device? Fingerprint ({0})
Your email is only used for password recovery
The name your friends see and can find you with
No chats? Go to the contacts tab to start one
This user has changed his key and this conversation might be unsecure. \'Reset\' will remove this warning.
Please describe the reason for the report
No contacts :(. You can click at the + at the top to find your friends or click scan to scan their fingerprint (If they are near you).

- On the contacts tab click on the + at the top.
 - Type the name of the person you are trying to add
 - If you found him click on his name which will send you to his profile
 -On the profile page click 'Add Contact'

If you cannot find someone check if you spelled their name correctly and if they have their name as public (This can be changed at the Profile tab)

Every user (and device) has a pair of keys, the one called public key is sent to the server and given to anyone that desires to communicate with that user. The private key is secured on the device and is only transferred when you pair another device. In essence a public key can lock a content (When sending a message) and a private key can unlock it (When receiving a message). The private key is also used for signing to verify the origin of the message.
Tap and hold the message, select \'Erase from this device\' to erase from the current device.\n\n* Tip: The option \'Take message back\' will remove the message from your contact\'s phone too!

A fingerprint is derived from a public key and can be used to compare two public keys (To check if they are the same). When you add a contact the server provides you their public key (And you derive that user’s fingerprint). Now let’s say you don’t trust us and want to make sure we didn’t changed the keys with our own (Which would give us access to all the messages). By scanning your friends fingerprint you will have a way to verify no one changed the keys and will be notified if someone does.

You can scan your friends fingerprint, this is not only an easy way to add you friends but also provides an offline way of verifying your friends identity. See \'What is a fingerprint\' for more info.

The lock means you haven\'t scanned your contact\'s fingerprint, doing so would increase the security of your conversation.\nThe alert icon means your contact got a new key after you scanned his fingerprint, this could mean the conversation was compromised or that your contact had to get a new key, if you see this icon you should verify your friends identity or rescan his fingerprint before sharing sensitive data.

Your device password will further lock down your device key, this will encrypt the local database with a key derived from that password. Without that password no one can access the data stored on that device.
This will delete any record of this account from the deviceand also notify the server that this device will no longer be used (Similar to deleting it).
Go to the devices tab, tap on the device you want to pair, and select pair.
This means your message did not send properly. Tap and hold the message to resend it.
To report someone tap and hold their name in the main page. This will give you the option to hide the conversation and report!
How do I erase a message?
What is the lock/alert icon on my conversation?
What happens if I select \'Erase all data\' when I logout?
How do I pair a device?
Why there is an X next to my message?
How do I report a conversation?
Display your fingerprint so your contacts can scan.
Please describe the reason for the report
Please describe the reason for the report

Your license to the Software under this Agreement continues until it is terminated by you or Etransfr. You may terminate the license by discontinuing use of all or any of the Software and by destroying all your copies of the Software. This Agreement will terminate automatically if (i) you violate any of the terms or conditions of this Agreement or the Chadder Terms of Use, or (ii) Etransfr publicly posts a written notice of termination on the Chadder website www.Chadder.com (that, or any successor site, the “Site”). All modifications or forms of new agreement shall be effective thirty (30) days after Etransfr’s notice thereof on the Site, by electronic or conventional mail, or by any other means by which you may obtain notice thereof. Use of the Software after thirty (30) days of such notice constitutes acceptance of such modifications or form of new agreement.
(b) Except with respect to your use of the Public Software as separate and independent from the Software, YOU MAY NOT decompile, reverse engineer, disassemble, modify, or create derivative works (as defined by the U.S. Copyright Act) or improvements (as defined by U.S. patent law) from the Software or any portion thereof, or seek to obtain intellectual property protection on the Software or any portion thereof. (i) use the Software in any unlawful manner, for any unlawful purpose or in any manner inconsistent with this Agreement;
(ii) transfer your rights under this Agreement to another person or entity ; or
(iii) use, acquire, ship, transport, export, or re-export the Software, except as permitted by applicable law. In particular, but without limitation, the Software may not be acquired, shipped, transported, exported, or re-exported (1) into (or to a national or resident of) any U.S. embargoed country or (2) to anyone on the U.S. Treasury Department's list of Specially Designated Nationals or the U.S. Department of Commerce's Table of Denial Orders. (d) Mandatory Upgrades. Etransfr may from time to time and at any time provide you (whether electronically by email or otherwise) with upgrades to the Software. Your continued ability to use the Software may be subject to and conditioned on your permitting Etransfr to install such upgrades or your prompt installation of them, as the case may be.

2. Public Software
You understand that the Software contains or is distributed with certain computer programs that are publicly available and that are distributed as part of the Software and for which the source code is written by persons or entities other than employees of Etransfr or contractors under the direction of Etransfr (the “Public Software”). The Public Software is listed in Exhibit A. (For purposes of this Agreement, the Software and any Public and other third party Software, together, shall be referred to as the “Software”.) If the Software contains any software provided by third parties not described as “Public Software” in Exhibit A, the restrictions contained in this Agreement shall apply to all such third party software providers and third party software as if they were Etransfr’s and the Software’s, respectively.
You acknowledge and agree that your use and distribution of any such Public Software is subject to the terms of the applicable Public Software license(s), and that you are responsible for your compliance with the terms of such Public Software license(s). (j) If any provision of this Agreement is declared by a court or tribunal of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, such provision shall be severed from this Agreement and the other provisions shall remain in full force and effect.
(k) Sections 1(b), 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 of this Agreement shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.
(l) This Agreement may be supplied to you in United States English and other languages. In case of conflict between any of these versions, the United States English version shall govern.

With Chadder you can send and receive messages from multiple devices including your phone, tablet, and computer (Still in progress).
We give you control over your messages, with Chadder you can delete the messages you sent, even from your friends phone!
With ghost pictures you can say how long you friends can look at a picture and it will be automatically deleted after.
This will erase all data related to this account, including it\'s key, are you sure you want to proceed?
You can either generate a new key by {0}, \nor pair the current device with another device to fix this.
You do not have a key.
Regret it? Tap and Hold to take it back!
This will delete ALL messages and pictures received/sent. Are you sure?
